questions.question_text:
The project manager has the following information about the estimated duration for an activity:
✑ Most likely [tM] `" 15 days
✑ Pessimistic [tP] `" 20 days
✑ Optimistic [tO] `" 10 days
What is the estimated duration of this activity, according to the triangular distribution technique?

comments.content: If you add all three together and divide by three, the answer is 15. (10 + 15 + 20 = 45, 45/3 = 15).

discussion.content: Why is the answer 15, not 12.5? I thought the triangulation technique is to add all three together, then divide by three.

Selected Answer: B
B for sure

Page 201 of 6th Edition of PMBOK

Depending on the assumed distribution of values within the range of the three estimates, the expected duration, tE, can be calculated. One commonly used formula is triangular distribution: tE = (tO + tM + tP) / 3.

So the answer is B. 15 Days

This should be 12.5

questions.question_text: A new vendor offers a one-time price break but cannot guarantee they will still be in the local market for any future projects. Which project management approach should be used to take advantage of this offer?

choices.C: Discuss feasible alternatives with functional managers in order to not affect project progress.
choices.D: Ask upper management to reinforce the project manager's authority over team members.
choices.B: Replace team members that are not 100% committed to the project.
choices.A: Send a memo to the project team that recalls their commitment to the project.

questions.question_text: While gathering nonfunctional requirements for developing a portal, which three aspects should a business analyst check to ensure that the solution developed will be fit for use by the customer? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:

The correct answers are:
B. Uptime D. Ease of use E. Reliability

D. Ease of use
E. Reliability

A burndown chart is a tool used in agile frameworks, including Scrumban, to visualize the progress of work completed over time. It shows the amount of work remaining versus time, allowing the team to see how much work has been completed within a sprint or a specific time frame. This makes it ideal for understanding what work has been completed during the week.

Selected Answer: D
This chart is specifically designed to show the amount of work completed versus the total work remaining over a specified time period. It's commonly used in Agile methodologies to track progress within a sprint or iteration.
FYI : A Kanban chart is a visual tool used to manage work in progress, but it doesn't focus on completed work.

Selected Answer: C
C. It asks, "what work has been completed." Kanban will show complete work details, while burndown will just show the amount of completed work.

Selected Answer: C
Scrum teams use burndown charts, Scrumban teams use Kanban. At least that is my understanding.

Explanation:
Burndown Chart: This chart tracks the amount of work remaining in a sprint or project over time. It visually represents the progress made, showing how much work has been completed versus how much is left. It is particularly useful for understanding the team's velocity and whether they are on track to complete their work by the end of the sprint.
Other Options:
A. Gantt Chart: Primarily used for project scheduling, it shows tasks over time but does not specifically indicate completed work in a way that is useful for agile teams.
B. Feature Chart: Typically used to track features in a product backlog, but it may not provide a clear view of completed work in a specific timeframe.
C. Kanban Chart: While it shows the flow of work and the current status of tasks, it may not specifically highlight completed work over a set period like a burndown chart does.

Selected Answer: D
Burndown chart visually represents the work remaining to be completed in a sprint. By looking at the difference between the starting point and the current point on the chart, you can determine the amount of work completed during the week.

Gantt chart is more commonly used in traditional project management and focuses on task dependencies and timelines.
Feature chart is not a standard chart in agile methodologies.
Kanban chart shows the workflow of work items but doesn't explicitly track work completed over a specific period.

Selected Answer: D
D, burn down chart
